metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value:
THE STATE OF SOUTH CAROLINS
CHARLESTON COUNTY

Personally appeared Bernard Boyd who being duly sworn says that he is informed and believes that M. Kelly, E. Dukes, A. Logan, Henry Smith, T. P. Vaughn, N. Johnson, J. H. Saunders, P. F. Johnson and W. H. Sutcliffe have unlawfully combined and conspired together to injure, harm and wrong this deponent and others in their property and character in that the said M. Kelly, E. Dukes, A. Logan, Henry Smith, T. P. Vaughn, N. Johnson, J. H. Saunders, P. F. Johnson and W. H. Sutcliffe unlawfully intending thereby to injure, hurt and harm this deponent and others in their property and character have conspired and combined together to unlawfully, corruptly and violently prevent the sale by this deponent and his co partner doing business as the firm of Boyd Bros. of the ale manufactured by Tracy and Russell of New York. That this defendant and his firm have been for near twenty years sellers of that brand of ale and have sold great quantities of the same in the State of South Carolina. That the object and intent of the said conspirators is to prevent any further sale of the same and thereby put an end to this business of this deponent and his said firm therein, and thereby to enjoin and impoverish the trade and property of this deponent and his said firm and of the said Tracy and Russell. That in furtherance and prosecution of their said unlawful and corrupt conspiracy and combination the said aforenamed conspirators have heretofore at sundry times and especially on the 1st, 2nd, and 3rd, days of March inst. avowed and declared that they had so unlawfully combined and conspired for the purpose aforesaid and did as the said times together openly threaten and intimidate by threats of injury and harm in their business parties who have heretofore purchased said ale from this deponent's said firm and in particular did so threaten and intimidate and attempt to intimidate Tiedeman
[End Page 1]
H. Kruger, A. F. Witt, F. L. Hackerman, H. Nolte, P. N. Gorse, J. F. Koester, C. H. Blase, C. H. G. Behlmer, L. C. Kangeter, C. A. Camman and Schultz Bros. and continue to threaten and attempt to so intimidate said parties and others who may hereafter purchase of the said deponent's said firm any of the said ale. 

Sworn to before me this
8th day of March 1890
[End Page 2]
